alert.note: Alert for Amador; Calaveras; El Dorado; Sacramento; San Joaquin; Solano; Stanislaus (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 11:56AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Amador, Calaveras, El Dorado, Sacramento, San Joaquin, Solano, Stanislaus, Tuolumne and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - We will see periods of moderate to heavy rain through the afternoon that will bring localized roadway flooding and rises on local streams and creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stockton, Modesto, Elk Grove, Vallejo, Fairfield, Vacaville, Tracy, Turlock, Ceres, Benicia, Galt, Oakdale, Jackson, Paloma, San Andreas, Manteca, Lodi, Suisun City, Riverbank and Patterson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Amador; Calaveras; El Dorado; Sacramento; San Joaquin; Solano; Stanislaus
